metadata.title: CVE-2023-52615 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: hwrng:core - Fix page fault dead lock on mmap-ed hwrng There is a dead-lock inthe hwrng device read path. This triggers when the user reads from/dev/hwrng into memory also mmap-ed from /dev/hwrng. The resulting pagefault triggers a recursive read which then dead-locks. Fix this by using astack buffer when calling copy_to_user.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52615` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-256-generic - 4.4.0-256.290~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-256-generic - 4.4.0-256.290~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-256-lowlatency - 4.4.0-256.290~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1133-aws - 4.4.0-1133.139
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-256.290~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1133.139').
linux-azure package in trusty is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
